ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.

936ef5df04d4.bio: +++ ??? +++ Out of Cheese Error. Redo From Start
936ef5df04d4.name: Hex

paragraphs.text: He challenges me to look at my convictions. Do they come from a place inside myself, or were they dictated by others? It is strange finding parts of yourself without ever realizing they had been lost. It’s like being tapped on the back and when you look around, someone is holding part of you and asks: “Excuse me, it this yours?” Your first reaction is more startled than happy. And confused because you can’t quite remember where this piece fit in. You have to expand your sense of self in order to include it again.

I’m not just finding parts of myself I’d lost. There are parts of me I knew were there, but went ignored and neglected. Parts I either didn’t think were worth developing, or didn’t have to courage to develop. Parts I thought were weak, that I tried to cover up and hide. Now my heart is in hands that treat it with more care and kindness I allowed myself to give it. It’s these parts that are now exposed. But instead of the injuries I feared, I feel them growing strong and proud. I am now wondering why I ever tried to hide those away.
paragraphs.name: 3a66

paragraphs.text: I seem to have forgotten . It is that long ago since I could say something like that about my own heart. If ever. Otherwise, wouldn’t it still be so? This makes me wonder if I have ever loved and been loved…
❤ meant every word!

paragraphs.name: 937a
paragraphs.text: One of my favorite things about your writing is the way you put your moments out like pieces of a puzzle. Your sentences always latch to each other gently and without friction; I’ll realize I love one sentence, not just because of how it rings on its own, but because of how it answers the one behind it, and meanders to the heart of the one in front…
